intro: Galium lucidum f. brachyphyllum, commonly known as the short-stemmed bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features slender, prostrate or ascending stems that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium lucidum f. brachyphyllum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
